title: How to Draw a Cartoon Bee

steps.headline: Start by drawing an oval that fills most of your paper.
steps.description: Be sure to leave enough space to draw the wings, legs and antennae!

steps.headline: Draw six lines coming from the bottom of the oval.
steps.description: You can draw smaller ovals onto these to look like feet if you like.

steps.headline: Draw two curved lines coming from the top left of the oval.
steps.description: Then add two circles. These are the antennae.

steps.headline: Add the wings.
steps.description: These are a bit like wonky circles but with a bit chopped off.

steps.headline: Draw the sting at the back of the bee.
steps.description: This is just a triangle on the right of the oval.

steps.headline: Draw a smile and two big eyes!
Color it in any way you want to!
steps.description: Remember to add stripes to the bee!

methods.name: Drawing a Bee Looking at You

steps.headline: Draw a round circle for the head, and cartoon-style eyes.
Draw the antennae and the smiley mouth.
steps.description: Or angry, sad or surprised if you wish! If you are in the creative mood, the circles on the antennae could be heart shaped, or star shaped.

steps.headline: Draw the body, six little legs, and that nasty stinger!
Draw the stripes on its body, and the wings on it's back.
Color it in, and you are done!
steps.description: Feel free to add a background! Sky, grass or whatever you would like!

text: Drawing a Plump Bee Start by drawing an oval that fills most of your paper. Be sure to leave enough space to draw the wings, legs and antennae! Draw six lines coming from the bottom of the oval. You can draw smaller ovals onto these to look like feet if you like. Draw two curved lines coming from the top left of the oval. Then add two circles. These are the antennae. Add the wings. These are a bit like wonky circles but with a bit chopped off. Draw the sting at the back of the bee. This is just a triangle on the right of the oval. Draw a smile and two big eyes! Give the bee some character! Color it in any way you want to! Remember to add stripes to the bee! Drawing a Bee Looking at You Draw a round circle for the head, and cartoon-style eyes.  Draw the antennae and the smiley mouth. Or angry, sad or surprised if you wish! If you are in the creative mood, the circles on the antennae could be heart shaped, or star shaped. Draw the body, six little legs, and that nasty stinger!  Draw the stripes on its body, and the wings on it's back.  Color it in, and you are done! Feel free to add a background! Sky, grass or whatever you would like!
